main_definition: A surname, also known as a family name or last name, is the part of a personal name that signifies one's family lineage and is passed down from generation to generation.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Last part of a person's full name used to identify family lineage
meanings_and_examples.example: John Doe is known as J.D., where 'Doe' serves as his surname.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The portion of a name that differentiates individuals with the same first and middle names, typically inherited from their parents
meanings_and_examples.example: Emily Johnson and Emily Brown share the same first and middle names but are distinguished by 'Johnson' and 'Brown' as their respective surnames.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A surname used in certain cultures to indicate clan or tribe membership
meanings_and_examples.example: The Clan MacDonald is a Scottish surname denoting lineage from the Donald line of a particular clan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to identify individuals as members of an extended family, especially in legal documents and official records
meanings_and_examples.example: In property deeds or wills, surnames such as 'Jones' may denote ownership by multiple heirs sharing the same last name.
